title: When executing a Test/start the app, which has an Rest endpoint annotated with @Parameter a warning is given

labels.name: triage/upstream
labels.description: Used for issues which are caused by issues in upstream projects/dependency

body:
### Describe the bug

I am not sure if it is a bug or not but is a change compared to the previous Quarkus version, which I have not seen described in any migration guide.

If it is not a bug, how can we achieve the same functionality, without the warning?

### Expected behavior

No warning should be seen in the console when starting the application or executing a test.
No warning is given in: 2.10.1.Final

### Actual behavior

A warning is seen in the console when starting the application or executing a test:

WARN: SROAP07902: @Parameter annotation missing JAX-RS parameter. Class: q.MyController, Method: javax.ws.rs.core.Response ep1(), Parameter.name: some, Parameter.in: header

Same behavior can be seen also in 2.12.2.Final 
[rest-client-reactive-quickstart14.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/9584130/rest-client-reactive-quickstart14.zip)


### How to Reproduce?

Run the provided test

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

uname -a Linux hty80028.sb1a.sparebank1.no 4.18.0-348.2.1.el8_5.x86_64 #1 SMP Mon Nov 8 13:30:15 EST 2021 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "11.0.10" 2021-01-19 OpenJDK Runtime Environment AdoptOpenJDK (build 11.0.10+9) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM AdoptOpenJDK (build 11.0.10+9, mixed mode)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.13.0.CR1

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
